full_summary:
**[1]** **Opening Information** 
---------------------------------

- **Title (English)** : Wharf Reconstruction - Miller Brook NB - Structure 406 and Structure 301
- **Tender Number** : EC015-230746/A
- **Classification** : Infrastructure Construction

**[2]** **Background Information**
--------------------------------

The Public Works and Government Services Canada intend to engage a contractor for the reconstruction of the wharf and related upgrades to Structures 406 and 301 in Miller Brook, NB. The project involves the construction of a new Berlin Wall Structure 406 and the reconstruction of the Breakwater Structure 301.

**[3]** **Project Overview**
-------------------------

The work to be undertaken under this contract includes, but is not limited to:

- Mobilization and demobilization
- Submission of environmental impact assessments
- Development of a Health and Safety Plan
- Development of a demolition plan
- Supply, installation, and maintenance of silt curtains to contain sediment flow
- Submission of As-Built plans
- Restoration of damaged zones
- Cleaning

All work will be performed in accordance with the approved plans and specifications of Public Works and Government Services Canada, including Reference Project R.118345.001 & R.119166.001.

The estimated cost of this opportunity falls within the category of $1,000,000 to $5,000,000 (inclusive of HST).

**[4]** **Document and Contact Information**
-----------------------------------------

Documents can be downloaded from CanadaBuys platform at <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/...> . The documents include plans, specifications, and bid security requirements.

 Any inquiries of a technical or contractual nature must be submitted in writing to Timothee Beausoleil, PWJ, e-mail <Timothee.Beausoleil2@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca>, telephone (902) 388-8377. Inquiries should be made no later than 5 business days prior to the close-of-bid date.

**[5]** **Tender Submission and Evaluation**
-----------------------------------------

The lowest price will be the selection criterion. All bidders are required to register with the Central Bidding Line under reference PWJ 0186254.

The documents contain addenda, amendments, and additional requirements. This requires careful consideration before bid submission. BSPC also encourages firms to register in SAP procurement platform.

**[6]** **Notice**
----------------

The Crown retains the right to negotiate during this bid.
